intro: Aeschynomene glandulosa, commonly known as the hairy sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and distinctive, hairy pods. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it has a shallow root system that allows it to thrive in poor soil conditions. Aeschynomene glandulosa is also known for its potential use in phytoremediation due to its ability to accumulate heavy metals.
